channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Elon Musk's X faces bans and investigations over nonconsensual bikini images
item.description: After the social media app's AI chatbot started generating sexualized images of women and children, two countries have blocked it and several more have launched investigations.
item.content:encoded:
After the social media app's AI chatbot started generating sexualized images of women and children, two countries have blocked it and several more have launched investigations.

(Image credit: Leon Neal)
item.dc:creator: Huo Jingnan

item.title: Venezuela begins releasing political prisoners, but hundreds remain behind bars
item.description: Venezuela has freed a handful of detainees in what it calls a gesture of national unity. Rights groups say releases are slow and the country's repressive system remains in place.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuela has freed a handful of detainees in what it calls a gesture of national unity. Rights groups say releases are slow and the country's repressive system remains in place.

(Image credit: Jesus Vargas)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Iran warns U.S. and Israel against military actions after deadly protests crackdown
item.description: Iran warned the U.S. and Israel against military action as activists said at least 203 people have been killed in the nationwide protests, a toll they say is likely far higher.
item.content:encoded: Iran warned the U.S. and Israel against military action as activists said at least 203 people have been killed in the nationwide protests, a toll they say is likely far higher.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Trump threatens Iran as country cracks down on protesters
item.description: President Trump has threatened Iran amid a deadly crackdown on protesters. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to Holly Dagres of the Washington Institute for Near East Policy about the protests.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has threatened Iran amid a deadly crackdown on protesters. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks to Holly Dagres of the Washington Institute for Near East Policy about the protests.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Malaysia, Indonesia become first to block Musk's Grok over AI deepfakes
item.description: Malaysia and Indonesia have become the first countries to block Grok, the artificial intelligence chatbot developed by Elon Musk's xAI, after authorities said it was being misused to generate sexually explicit and non-consensual images.
item.content:encoded:
Malaysia and Indonesia have become the first countries to block Grok, the artificial intelligence chatbot developed by Elon Musk's xAI, after authorities said it was being misused to generate sexually explicit and non-consensual images.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump threatens 'strong' military action as Iran protest deaths rise
item.description: Hundreds of protesters have been killed in Iran, rights groups say, as President Trump threatened "strong" military action.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of protesters have been killed in Iran, rights groups say, as President Trump threatened "strong" military action.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Iran protests enter third week under internet blackout
item.description: As Iran's protests enter a third week, the country's president blames foreign powers for the unrest, and warns it will retaliate if the US intervenes militarily.
item.content:encoded: As Iran's protests enter a third week, the country's president blames foreign powers for the unrest, and warns it will retaliate if the US intervenes militarily.
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Historic upset in English soccer's FA Cup as Macclesfield beat holders Crystal Palace
item.description: The result marks the first time in 117 years that a side from outside the major national leagues has eliminated the reigning FA Cup holders.
item.content:encoded:
The result marks the first time in 117 years that a side from outside the major national leagues has eliminated the reigning FA Cup holders.

(Image credit: Michael Regan)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Latin American left responds to Trump's pledge to take over of Venezuelan oil
item.description: Latin America's left is in disarray after the seizure of Nicolas Maduro and the U.S.'s pledge to take over Venezuela's oil industry. Many on the left are changing their rhetoric about President Trump.
item.content:encoded: Latin America's left is in disarray after the seizure of Nicolas Maduro and the U.S.'s pledge to take over Venezuela's oil industry. Many on the left are changing their rhetoric about President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: After Venezuela, is the world order shifting from diplomacy towards aggression?
item.description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks with Peter Krause of Boston College about the Trump Administration's willingness to act unilaterally against other countries and what this means for international relations.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks with Peter Krause of Boston College about the Trump Administration's willingness to act unilaterally against other countries and what this means for international relations.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer
